noun.description: In biblical use, and allusions to this: a group of people despised and cast aside like rubbish; scum, riff-raff. Occasionally in singular: a worthless or contemptible person.
Filth or defilement cleaned off and thrown away; refuse, rubbish, dregs.

origin: Early 16th century; earliest use found in The New Testament. From off- + scouring.
